page.title: 13MORE CLUBS IN N.FERRIBY.
page.content: The{DRAMA SOCIETY}was first started by The W.I. in 1948.Mrs.Johnson was the producer then and for the next 21 years.First they used a little room at the back of the bakery.However for the last 2 years they have rehearsed at Oddfellows Hall.Membership costs Â£5 to join, but is free for those under 18.Their last play was "Hay Fever", a comedy. The{WOMEN'S INSTITUTE}started in 1925 when women decided to form their own society. We interviewed the President, Mrs. Pinnock, a member for four years. Members meet every month at the Village Hall from 7.30p.m. till about 10p.m.They have talks ranging from mugging to wildlife.At Christmas they do plays and pantomimes.Ladies over 60 dress up as fairies.The W.I. hope for more younger members in the future.
